an3.85:4.1: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha,
an3.85:4.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an3.85:5.1: “Sir, they speak of this person called ‘a trainee’.
an3.85:5.3: “They train, mendicant, that’s why they’re called ‘a trainee’.
an3.85:5.5: They train in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.
an3.85:5.6: They train, that’s why they’re called ‘a trainee’.”
an3.85:6.4: final knowledge follows in the same lifetime.
an3.85:7.1: After that, to that poised one, freed by final knowledge
an3.85:7.2: with the end of the fetters of rebirth,
